snippet: In two recent books photographers document sites that governments might prefer to forget: the airfield where the Enola Gay was prepared for its mission and the zone around Chernobyl.
abstract: Two recent books of photography wrestle with remembering history, even if it is an uncomfortable one; The Half-Life of History: The Atomic Bomb and Wendover Air Base by photographer Mark Klett and writer WIlliam L Fox focuses on the airfield where the Enola Gay was prepared before its mission; Chernobyl Zone (I) by the Russian photographer Andrej Krementschouk ushers us into the restricted zone around Chernobyl.
lead_paragraph: In two recent books photographers document sites that governments might prefer to forget: the airfield where the Enola Gay was prepared for its mission and the zone around Chernobyl.

headline.seo: Photographs of Wendover Air Base and Chernobyl
